timings.name: Study Drug Administration after Hypoglycemia Induction

conditions.name: Admission Rescheduling Condition
conditions.description: Admission can be rescheduled if plasma glucose is outside the specified range on Day 1.
conditions.text: PG level is not 90 to 250 mg/dL on Day 1.

conditions.name: Stop Insulin Infusion Condition
conditions.description: Criteria to stop the insulin infusion during the hypoglycemia induction procedure.

conditions.name: Interim Safety Review
conditions.description: A safety review is required after the first 6 patients complete Period 2 before dosing remaining patients.
conditions.text: Safety data will be reviewed after the first 6 patients are administered LY900018 in Period 2, and the remaining patients will be dosed after confirmation of the safety.

conditions.name: Study Stopping Rule
conditions.description: The entire study may be stopped based on the interim safety review.
conditions.text: Following the review of the safety data from the first 6 patients to complete Period 2 Day 1, the study will be stopped if deemed necessary for patient safety in the opinion of the Investigator and sponsor.

conditions.name: Patient Replacement Criteria
conditions.description: Criteria for replacing a patient who discontinues from the study.
conditions.text: If patients discontinue from the study before completion of both periods with evaluable primary outcome for any reason, the patient may be replaced.

conditions.name: Patient Replacement Limit
conditions.description: Condition limiting the total number of enrolled patients when replacing subjects.
conditions.text: Replacement should not occur beyond 75 patients enrolled, if it is expected to have at least 66 patients complete the study.

conditions.name: Inadvertently Enrolled Patient Review
conditions.description: Procedure for determining if an inadvertently enrolled patient can continue in the study.
conditions.text: If the sponsor or investigator identifies a patient who did not meet enrollment criteria and was inadvertently enrolled, a discussion must occur between the Lilly CP/CRP and the investigator to determine if the patient may continue in the study.

transitionRules.name: Screen to Treatment Transition
transitionRules.text: Subject must meet all eligibility criteria and be randomized prior to study drug administration on Period 1 Day 1.

transitionRules.name: Transition to Additional Follow-up
transitionRules.text: Patients with treatment-emergent antidrug antibodies (TE ADA) at follow-up/ED will undergo additional follow-up.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Completion
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Completion of all protocol-required visits, including the final follow-up visit.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Completion of Additional Follow-up
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Criteria for completing the additional follow-up period for TE ADA positive patients.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Discontinuation for Other Study Enrollment
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Patient is discontinued for enrolling in another incompatible clinical study.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Discontinuation for Medical, Safety, or Regulatory Reasons
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Patient is discontinued for various reasons consistent with regulations and good clinical practice.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Discontinuation by Investigator Decision
scheduleTimelineExits.description: The investigator decides to discontinue the patient from the study for any reason.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Discontinuation by Patient Decision
scheduleTimelineExits.description: The patient or their legal representative requests to be withdrawn from the study.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Lost to Follow-up
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Patient is considered lost to follow-up if they repeatedly fail to return for scheduled visits and cannot be contacted.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Decision to Continue Dosing
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision point to continue dosing remaining patients or stop the study based on interim safety review.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Decision on Inadvertently Enrolled Patient
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision point to determine if an inadvertently enrolled patient may continue in the study.
